content.description:
This is just right of

Bolt Be Gone

on the black rock. Climb the overhanging face to a smooth plaque of rock to the finish.
content.location:
It is just right of

Bolt Be Gone

.

content.description:
Climb the first two bolts of

Take It To The Limit

, and traverse to

The Ride For Life

. This variation skips the difficult starting moves on

The Ride For Life

but still climbs the bulk of the fun arête.
content.location:
Start on

Take It To The Limit

.

content.description: Take It To The Limit is a short but stout route that packs a punch in 30 feet. Climb up and right on good holds before going back left to the crux where you test the limit of your reach.
content.location:
This is the next route right of

Take That!

, starting up and left from large pine tree below the arete.

content.description:
Climb the first three bolts of

Nothing Like a Stick in the Eye

, and cut right, climbing on big holds to the anchor in the middle of the face where the face blanks out.
content.location:
Start on

Nothing Like a Stick in the Eye

.

content.description: Begin with a difficult move onto a shelf before moving right to the arête. Climb the arête on big, positive holds, passing a large flake which won’t budge with a crowbar. If it does go, you’ll take “the ride for life." Above, finish with technical moves on the slabby arête at the top.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Nothing Like a Stick in the Eye

content.description: Climb the orange face with a strenuous crux at the third bolt. Easier climbing on good holds leads to technical climbing that hugs the arête to finish.
content.location: Climb just right of the arete with a left-facing flake down low.

climbs.name: Bolt Be Gone
climbs.fa: Mike Schneiter, Joy Schneiter, BJ Sbarra

content.description: Climb the crack in the right-facing dihedral to a steep finish with good holds. It has a hard start.
content.protection: Gear to #1 Camalot with extra small pieces and a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This is on the far left of the Jungle Gym, in a right-facing dihedral.

content.description: Climb black rock using balance and technical movement.
content.location:
Start about 20-30 feet to the right of the arete where

The Ride for Life

begins.

content.description: Begin on big, angled holds before climbing on big holds through a small roof. Above the small ledge, use holds on the arête to climb past the final two bolts to the anchor.
content.location: This is the furthest route on the right.
